fields.description:
{panel:title=Information about the fix|bgColor=#DEEBFF|borderColor=#000000}
In order to have this issue resolved:

 * upgrade to Fisheye / Crucible 4.8.3 or higher AND
 * ensure you have 'Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable' installed

See the 'Notes' section below.
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

When fisheye is installed as a service on Windows with AdoptJDK AWT doesn't work (avatars not displayed).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Spin up a fresh Windows machine. Tested on 2019 and 2012.
 # Install AdoptJDK (8.0.242.08-hotspot)
 # Install Fisheye
 # open Services utility, make sure Fisheye is running or start it
 # navigate to fisheye web ui and log in

h3. Expected Results

Default avatar is displayed.
h3. Actual Results

1) During Fisheye startup the following stack trace is logged:
{noformat}
2020-04-30 08:15:13,815 WARN  - Problem initing graphics environment, images may not render
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class java.awt.Toolkit
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Run.setLibraryProperties(Run.java:421) [fisheye.jar:?]
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.BaseCommand.handleCommonArguments(BaseCommand.java:166) [fisheye.jar:?]
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Run.mainImpl(Run.java:74) [fisheye.jar:?]
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Run.main(Run.java:55) [fisheye.jar:?]
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) [?:1.8.0_252]
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) [?:1.8.0_252]
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) [?:1.8.0_252]
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498) [?:1.8.0_252]
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.FishEyeCtl.mainImpl(FishEyeCtl.java:101) [fisheyeboot.jar:?]
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.FishEyeCtl.main(FishEyeCtl.java:44) [fisheyeboot.jar:?]
{noformat}
2) When rendering a page containing an avatar, no image displayed and the below exception is thrown in the log file:
{noformat}
javax.servlet.ServletException: java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at com.opensymphony.webwork.dispatcher.DispatcherUtils.serviceAction(DispatcherUtils.java:285) [webwork-2.2.7-atlassian-37.jar:?]
	at com.opensymphony.webwork.dispatcher.ServletDispatcher.service(ServletDispatcher.java:111) [webwork-2.2.7-atlassian-37.jar:?]
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:790) [javax.servlet-api-3.1.0.jar:3.1.0]
[...]
Caused by: java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) [?:1.8.0_242]
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) [?:1.8.0_242]
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) [?:1.8.0_242]
[...]
Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class javax.imageio.ImageIO
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.gravatar.Charlatar.getImage(Charlatar.java:163) [fisheye.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.gravatar.Charlatar.rndpart(Charlatar.java:159) [fisheye.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.gravatar.Charlatar.createAvatar(Charlatar.java:71) [fisheye.jar:?]
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Install another JDK (Oracle) or use different way of installing service (nssm). 
h3. Notes

1) Error during startup. OpenJDK around version 1.8.0 update 202, in the {{awt.dll}} library introduced a dependency on 'Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable 2013'. Download and install this package from the Microsoft website (vcredist_x64.exe). Once installed, the {{java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class java.awt.Toolkit}} error from Fisheye's startup disappears.

2) Error while generating an avatar. It's related with loading SPI modules by javax.imageio.ImageIO. Behaviour is random (stop + start resolves the issue in half of cases). Solving this requires an update to Fisheye/Crucible *4.8.3* or higher.
fields.summary: Problem with AWT on Windows with AdoptJDK (avatars not displayed).

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
- During indexing of a repo Fisheye will use git to calculate blame
- If git is unable to find blame origin for a commit it may return the following {{fatal: internal error in blame::find_origin (D)}}
- The index of the repo will not complete if this error is encountered

h3. Suggested Solution
- Fisheye should be able to handle this error more gracefully with perhaps a clear call to action to disable blame calculation at the appropriate level ie. per repo by disabling "store diff info" setting or system wide via a system property - {{fisheye.blame.calc.enable}}
 
h3. Workaround 
- Disabling blame calculation should allow the repo to index successfully with the caveat that LoC will also be disabled
fields.summary: Fisheye should handle this specific git error - blame::find_origin (D)-  more gracefully

fields.description:
h3. +Problem Definition+

Customers might need to disable the *{{crucibleprefs1}}* and / or *{{remember}}* browser cookies completely, or at least shorten their lifespans.

Currently there is no way to do that in Fisheye.
h3. +Suggested Solution+

Create [JVM System Properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/jvm-system-properties-960155689.html] that allow doing that.
h3. +Workaround+
{panel:title=Please note|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#cccccc|titleBGColor=#f7d6c1|bgColor=#ffffce}
(i)
 This workaround has been tested against Fisheye / Crucible 4.6+
{panel}
Use Byteman rules to do that. Thus far, we have only found out how to shorten the lifespan of the {{crucibleprefs1}} cookie, we were unable to find out how to do the same for the {{remember}} cookie, which then needs to be disabled completely.
h4. Byteman rule to shorten the lifespan of {{crucibleprefs1}} to 1 day:
{code:java}
RULE Change crucibleprefs1 age to one day
CLASS com.cenqua.fisheye.web.PreferenceManager
METHOD makeCookie
AT EXIT
IF true
DO $cookie.setMaxAge(86400);
org.slf4j.LoggerFactory.getLogger("Byteman").info("Cookie 'crucibleprefs1' lifespan has been shortened to: " + $cookie.getMaxAge());
ENDRULE
{code}
h4. Byteman rule to disable the {{remember}} cookie completely:
{code:java}
RULE com.cenqua.fisheye.user.DefaultUserManager#loginWithSanitizedUserName entry
CLASS com.cenqua.fisheye.user.DefaultUserManager
METHOD loginWithSanitizedUserName
AT ENTRY
IF true
DO $5 = false;
org.slf4j.LoggerFactory.getLogger("Byteman").info("Cookie 'remember' has been disabled");
ENDRULE 
{code}
h4. Enabling Byteman in Fisheye:

Please see [Enable Byteman for additional logging in Fisheye and Crucible|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fishkb/enable-byteman-for-additional-logging-in-fisheye-and-crucible-943956769.html]
fields.summary: Allow disabling or shortening the lifespan of crucibleprefs1 and remember browser cookies

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When _Fisheye/Crucible_ 4.7 is upgrade to 4.8 and linked with _Jira_ 8.3.4 the application link's status is "Deprecated" when the [existing application link is upgraded|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE034/Upgrading+an+Application+Link]. When a new application link to _Jira_ is created it shows "Connected", but the warning "There are existing Trusted Applications or OAuth relationships that should be upgraded to Application Links. Click here to upgrade." does not go away after a restart. This does not hinder the normal operation of the Application link.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upgrade _Fisheye/Crucible_  4.7 (with an existing Application link to _Jira_) to 4.8 
# Login to the upgraded _Fisheye/Crucible_  
# Go to application links and delete the exisiting application link to Jira
# Click "click here to upgrade" from the _"There are existing Trusted Applications..."_ warning sign
# [Upgrade the application link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE034/Upgrading+an+Application+Link] 
# No errors in the log

h3. Expected Results
Application link will be upgraded and have the status connected as shown in _FeCru.png_


h3. Actual Results
Application link shows "deprecated' as shown in _upgrade link.png_


h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Upgrading Existing Trust Relationship results in Applink Deprecated

fields.description: If someone else has reviewed the same code and added a comment close enough to what you'd want to say, the ability to add a 'like' to it, perhaps raising to needs resolving after 3 or more likes?
fields.summary: Add likes to existing comment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The UPM 'Manage add-ons' page reloads infinitely when using administration password (not logged in).

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* log-in using the 'Administration' link (a password-only dialog) from the page footer
* go to 'Manage add-ons' page

h3. Expected Results

Page loads successfully

h3. Actual Results

Page reloads infinitely as shown in the attached mov file

h3. Workaround

Log in using user account with administrator privileges. See Administration > Security Settings > Administrators.
fields.summary: Universal Plugin Manager page reloads infinitely when using admin password (not logged in)

fields.description:
Upgrade atlassian-core from currently used 4.6.23 to the latest 7.0.2 version. 

Add dependency on atlassian-core-thumbnail as classes have been moved to a separate artifact. Changes in thumbnails:

* Thumber#getImage(File) -> Thumber#getImage(InputStream)
* Thumber.WidthHeightHelper -> ThumbnailDimension
* Thumber#getThumbnailMimeTypes() is removed
fields.summary: Upgrade atlassian-core to 7.0.2

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When you have Fisheye integrated with Bitbucket Server via Application Links and add a Bitbucket repository as such in Fisheye (i.e., not as regular Git repo), and the repository gets renamed *only* in Bitbucket Server afterwards, Fisheye will still receive the remote event notification from Bitbucket Server and as expected will fail to trigger the incremental index because the new repository URL will not be found in Fisheye.

The problem is that only when debug logging is enabled Fisheye will write in the logs that the remote event was ignored because it is considered "non-local" (i.e., no repositories with the new URL could be found locally). In addition to adding this notification in regular logging, the admin web interface should show a notification somewhere as well.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate Fisheye 4.7.0 with Bitbucket Server 5.7.3 via Application Links
 # Create the remote consumer tokens
 # Add the Bitbucket repository to Fisheye
 # Let Fisheye index the repository
 # Commit and push changes to Bitbucket Server and notice that this change will show up in Fisheye almost immediately, and the following is written in both application logs:
 ** Bitbucket Server dispatches the remote event notification:
{noformat}
2020-02-18 15:03:31,301 DEBUG [events.remote.ratelimit.threads:thread-1]  c.a.e.r.impl.RemoteEventDispatcher Found dispatch batches: List((https://my.company.com/fisheye/rest/remote-event-consumer/latest/events/stash-repository-refs-changed-remote-event,com.atlassian.stash.plugin.remote.event.StashRepositoryRefsChangedEvent@29dd9872[cloneLinks=[CloneLink{name=http, href=https://217216x710826@git.company.com/scm/abc/myrepo.git}, CloneLink{name=ssh, href=ssh://git@git.company.com:7999/abc/myrepo.git}],repositoryProject=ABC,repositorySlug=myrepo,committer=217216x710826,sourceId=<null>,sourceUrl=<null>]))
{noformat}

 ** Fisheye receives the remote event notification, triggers an incremental indexing, and incremental indexing starts immediately:
{noformat}
2020-02-18 15:03:31,341 DEBUG [qtp1095352419-8907 ] com.atlassian.event.remote.impl.rest.RemoteEventConsumerResource RemoteEventConsumerResource-receiveEvent - Publishing event com.atlassian.stash.plugin.remote.event.StashRepositoryRefsChangedEvent@69979e14[cloneLinks=[CloneLink{name=ssh, href=ssh://git@git.company.com:7999/abc/myrepo.git}, CloneLink{name=http, href=https://217216x710826@git.company.com/scm/abc/myrepo.git}],repositoryProject=ABC,repositorySlug=myrepo,committer=217216x710826,sourceId=e784b133-58eb-3726-b9a3-e6611271704c,sourceUrl=https://git.company.com] from request 71602fa6-79d2-4077-815c-46395eb5da5f to capability stash-repository-refs-changed-remote-event
2020-02-18 15:03:31,342 DEBUG [qtp1095352419-8907 ] fisheye DefaultRepositoryAdminService-incrementalIndex - Incremental index triggered for repository myrepo
2020-02-18 15:03:31,350 DEBUG [IncrPing3 myrepo ] fisheye RepositoryStatus-setMessage - Status change [myrepo]: Contacting repository.
{noformat}

 # Rename the repository in Bitbucket (which will make the clone URL change)
 # Commit and push changes to Bitbucket Server and notice that this change will not show up in Fisheye:
 ** Bitbucket Server dispatches the remote event notification:
{noformat}
2020-02-18 15:05:09,569 DEBUG [events.remote.ratelimit.threads:thread-3]  c.a.e.r.impl.RemoteEventDispatcher Found dispatch batches: List((https://my.company.com/fisheye/rest/remote-event-consumer/latest/events/stash-repository-refs-changed-remote-event,com.atlassian.stash.plugin.remote.event.StashRepositoryRefsChangedEvent@5f3b7030[cloneLinks=[CloneLink{name=http, href=https://217216x710826@git.company.com/scm/abc/mynewreponame.git}, CloneLink{name=ssh, href=ssh://git@git.company.com:7999/abc/mynewreponame.git}],repositoryProject=ABC,repositorySlug=mynewreponame,committer=217216x710826,sourceId=<null>,sourceUrl=<null>]))
{noformat}

 ** Fisheye receives the remote event notification and ignores it:
{noformat}
2020-02-18 15:05:09,612 DEBUG [qtp1095352419-8907 ] com.atlassian.event.remote.impl.rest.RemoteEventConsumerResource RemoteEventConsumerResource-receiveEvent - Publishing event com.atlassian.stash.plugin.remote.event.StashRepositoryRefsChangedEvent@6c83fa24[cloneLinks=[CloneLink{name=http, href=https://217216x710826@git.company.com/scm/abc/mynewreponame.git}, CloneLink{name=ssh, href=ssh://git@git.company.com:7999/abc/mynewreponame.git}],repositoryProject=ABC,repositorySlug=mynewreponame,committer=217216x710826,sourceId=e784b133-58eb-3726-b9a3-e6611271704c,sourceUrl=https://git.company.com] from request a9a69d62-31a8-4e21-9131-a6e0f12d7751 to capability stash-repository-refs-changed-remote-event
2020-02-18 15:05:09,634 DEBUG [qtp1095352419-8907 ] com.atlassian.event.remote.impl.RemoteEventListener RemoteEventListener-onRemoteEvent - Ignoring non-local RemoteEvent com.atlassian.stash.plugin.remote.event.StashRepositoryRefsChangedEvent@6c83fa24[cloneLinks=[CloneLink{name=http, href=https://217216x710826@git.company.com/scm/abc/mynewreponame.git}, CloneLink{name=ssh, href=ssh://git@git.company.com:7999/abc/mynewreponame.git}],repositoryProject=ABC,repositorySlug=mynewreponame,committer=217216x710826,sourceId=e784b133-58eb-3726-b9a3-e6611271704c,sourceUrl=https://git.company.com]
{noformat}

 # As can be seen, the log line which says that the remote event was ignored is only written when {{DEBUG}} logging is enabled.

h3. Suggested Solution

This log line should also be written when {{DEBUG}} logging is disabled - maybe with {{WARN}} logging level - and the admin interface should notify about this problem somewhere.
h3. Workaround
Enable debug logging so as to see the message
fields.summary: Improve notification when automatic incremental index sent by remote event fails

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Selecting a large number of code reviews can put an instance under heavy load. Currently API does not provide paging or does not truncate results.

This happens in case REST API is used, such as:

 * {{/rest-service/reviews-v1/details?state=<value>}}  (e.g. closed)
 * {{/rest-service/reviews-v1/filter/<filter>}} (e.g. 'allReviews')

or when RSS XML feed is called for a search result, such as:

 * {{/cru/rssReviewFilter?<query parameters>}}

or when Java API is used, such as:

 * {{com.cenqua.crucible.model.managers.ReviewManager#getReviews}} with {{details=true}} 
 * {{com.atlassian.crucible.spi.services.ReviewService#getCustomFilterReviews}} with {{details=true}} and too wide filter
 * {{com.atlassian.crucible.spi.services.ReviewService#getFilteredReviews}} with {{details=true}} and too wide filter


The above can be identified by browsing access logs (you have to [enable access logging|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crucible/enabling-access-logging-in-crucible-298977518.html] first).

Primary symptom:
 * logs contain a warning like:

{quote}
2020-01-29 05:13:51,493 INFO  [qtp1267105885-991957 ] fisheye DefaultReviewManager-getReviewsByIds - Requesting more than 500 reviews may have a negative impact on performance and memory usage of Crucible. *21509 reviews selected.*
{quote}

Additional symptoms:
 * high heap consumption and heavy GC activity
 * a number of web threads (qtp-*) running for a long time (minutes), thread dumps showing DefaultReviewManager in the stack trace
 * instance becoming unresponsive
 * OutOfMemoryError

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Load significantly more than 500 code reviews using REST API or RSS feed (an exact number depends on size of your instance)

h3. Expected Results

An instance limits number of results.

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-fisheye-YYYY-MM-DD.log file:

{noformat}
DefaultReviewManager-getReviewsByIds - Requesting more than 500 reviews may have a negative impact on performance and memory usage of Crucible. NNNN reviews selected.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

(/) Identify source of these queries (e.g. user's RSS feeds, automated scripts using REST API) and refine the queries used.

(/) Install the following Byteman script. It will truncate results to 500 items.

* script:  [^reviewmanager-getmatchingreviewids-limit.btm] 
* instruction: https://confluence.atlassian.com/fishkb/enable-byteman-for-additional-logging-in-fisheye-and-crucible-943956769.html
fields.summary: Lack of query limits on review search can bring an instance down

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a linker with a regex that partially matches commit ids is applied to a repository, the linker gets applied incorrectly to the commit ids in the search result pages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add linker to any git/svn repository (*Repositories* > *Linkers* > *Add*) either globally or for one repo.
 # Add
{noformat}
(?:(?<!\w|-)|bug)(\d{1,2}){noformat}
as regular expression and a URL/href such as "jiramia"

 # Navigate to activity stream and hover over a changeset. In this case "9". At the bottom left, the href is correct: ([http://localhost:4480/f480/changelog/linktest?cs=9])
 # If you search for 9, or another file, then type 9 in the search field, it returns 9 identified as a commit message. There is no 9 in the commit message for that revision. Hover over 9, then the link is rendered as: "jiramia" which is the fake href I added. Clicking on changeset 9 from the search result message redirect to the to website defined in the linker.
 !linker-test.png|width=470,height=402!

h3. Expected Results

The linker is only applied to commit messages and comments
h3. Actual Results

The linker is also applied to commit ids on the search page if the regex matches.
h3. Workaround

No workaround currently if the linker matches. Tweak the linker i.e. to require the bug number to be preceded by "BugId: " phrase
fields.summary: In search results, the linker gets applied to commit IDs

fields.summary: The org.eclipse.jetty.webapp.ClasspathPattern throws NullPointerException on application startup

fields.description:
As per design, right now we can use the smart-commit #comment command only in the commit's subject, like this for example:

{{#comment Add Crashliytics to Xcode project [JIRA-ID]}}
 
Suggestion:
Allow the use of the #comment in the body, for example:

{{Add Crashlytics to Xcode project [JIRA-ID]

#comment I added the Firebase frameworks using the 
manual method instead of CocoaPods, because .....}}
fields.summary: Smart-Commit: Allow #comment in commit body

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In some cases, especially for merge commits, the 'Blame' action does not retrieve data from Fisheye's repository indexes but calls the Mercurial SCM to get blame data.

In case when the file contains mixed CR and CR-LF line endings, fetching the blame fails.

Note: this case is similar to FE-7255, but in this bug report repository indexing succeeds, but it is impossible to get the blame afterwards.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Download the attached  [^repo3.tar.gz] Mercurial repository
 # Add repository to Fisheye and wait until it's indexed
 # Open the commit history, open the newest merge commit, open a file named 'file', click the 'Blame' button

h3. Expected Results

Blame is shown for a file.

h3. Actual Results

An error message is shown in the UI as below:

!blame-server-not-responding.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-fisheye-YYYY-MM-DD.log}} file:

{noformat}

Mercurial handles mixed line endings in a special way. When calling *hg annotate* it is expected to see a revision number for every line in the source file. But in case when CR-CR-LF sequence is present the output looks similar to the following:

{noformat}

              # we have no "1:" here
1:c
0:d
{noformat}

Fisheye's indexer fails to parse an empty line from "hg annotate".

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

h3. Issue Summary

Fisheye when indexing a Mercurial repository fetches data using commands line 'hg cat', 'hg annotate' or 'hg felog' (a custom plugin). In case when a file in a commit contains mixed CR and CR-LF line endings, indexing mail fail. This happens in particular for merge commits, as for commits with 2 parents Fisheye makes an additional call to SCM.

Indexing stops with an error like:

{noformat}

Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to match line  using pattern: \s*([0-9a-fA-F]{12})\s*(.+?):\s*(\d+):.*?
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.hg.client.HgBlameParser.processChunkLine(HgBlameParser.java:61) [fisheye.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.hg.client.HgBlameParser.processLine(HgBlameParser.java:35) [fisheye.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.utils.process.LineOutputHandler.process(LineOutputHandler.java:70) [atlassian-processutils-1.5.14.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.utils.process.LineOutputHandler.process(LineOutputHandler.java:33) [atlassian-processutils-1.5.14.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.utils.process.PluggableProcessHandler.processOutput(PluggableProcessHandler.java:127) [atlassian-processutils-1.5.14.jar:?]
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.util.NamedProcessHandler.processOutput(NamedProcessHandler.java:31) [fisheye.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.utils.process.ExternalProcessImpl$3.doTask(ExternalProcessImpl.java:315) [atlassian-processutils-1.5.14.jar:?]
	... 4 more
{noformat}

h3. Root cause

Mercurial handles mixed line endings in a special way. For example, when calling *hg annotate* it is expected to see a revision number for every line in the source file. But in case when CR-CR-LF sequence is present the output looks similar to the following:

{noformat}
0:a
1:b         # line ends with CR, it "flows" into next line so
              # we have no "1:" here
1:c
0:d
{noformat}

Similarly, when running *hg diff* it is expected to see "+" / "-" markers for added and removed lines. But in case when CR-CR-LF sequence is present, the added files are rendered like:

{noformat}
a
+b
             # no '+' here
+c
d
{noformat}

Fisheye's indexer fails to parse an empty line from diff / annotate / felog.

h3. Workaround

Open Administration > Repositories > (view repository settings) > SCM Details tab.
Disable the 'Store diff info' option.

Please note that FE-7256 will occur for end users in case they try to fetch blame information for files which previously failed to index.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When navigating to the application links page in Fisheye, clicking on "Jira settings" on a Jira application link leads to an error page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an application link from Fisheye to Jira
 # Navigate to Fisheye's application link page
 # Click on the "..." and select "Jira Settings"

h3. Expected Results

Either a page with settings shows up or that option is removed since it doesn't lead anywhere

h3. Actual Results

Receive an error page

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
2019-12-07 14:40:06,891 ERROR [qtp131872530-988 ] com.opensymphony.webwork.dispatcher.DispatcherUtils DispatcherUtils-serviceAction - Could not find action
There is no Action mapped for namespace /admin and action name updateJiraServer-default. Check if there is such an action name with such namespace defined in the xwork.xml and also if such an action class exists. Check also the log to see if the action class is successfully loaded. - [unknown location]
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

No workaround, but there is no missing functionality.

{quote}
 Fisheye provides a "read-only" connection to Jira for user management.
{quote}
Later in the page under "Jira Software server permissions" we specify the "Read/write" option.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

The "Read/Write" option is not available under "Jira Server Permissions" section. This will be similar to the text on the [https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/connecting-to-crowd-960155581.html|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/connecting-to-crowd-960155581.html] page under "crowd permissions"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Indexing repository using svn native client version 1.10 is constantly requesting for password for every call to client performed by Fisheye, which results in major performance degradation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use svn native client 1.10 version (see https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/native-support-for-svn-960155253.html)
 # Perform indexing using this client
 # Observe logs

h3. Expected Results

Fisheye logs should not show svn client prompting for password every call. 

 
h3. Actual Results
 * Fisheye calls to native svn client causes it to prompt for password every time it's called (see attachment)
 * Performance of indexing is degradated

h3. Workaround

This issue is caused by the fact that svn client is trying to find password only in defined password stores. These are being set in {{~/.subversion/config}} file (or {{/etc/subversion/config}}) in *[auth]* section under *password-stores* key. There is no fallback mechanism to check file-cached passwords. A workaround would be to disable the password stores (by setting "password-stores = " in the config file).
fields.summary: Indexing repository using svn native client version 1.10 heavily slows down due to frequent requesting for password

fields.description:
h3. In Fisheye 4.7 and older we have:

| *Property* | *Default* | *Min* | *Max* | 
| fisheye.changeset.paths.limit | 10000 | unlimited | unlimited | 
| fisheye.pipeline.batch.cslimit | 10000 | 1 | 50000 | 
| fisheye.pipeline.batch.pathlimit | 60000 | 1000 | 120000 | 

Explanation:
* fisheye.changeset.paths.limit - Maximum number of paths to be indexed for search (Lucene) in a single changeset. Note that this affects only a search. Repository index always contains all paths from a changeset. 
* fisheye.pipeline.batch.cslimit - Maximum number of changesets processed in a single batch. Fisheye can adjust value automatically between 1 and cslimit, see below. 
* fisheye.pipeline.batch.pathlimit - Maximum number of paths (files) processed in a single batch. When limit is exceeded, scanner throws an exception, it pauses and re-scans with a lower value of cslimit.

h3. New values proposed for Fisheye 4.8:

| *Property* | *Default* | *Min* | *Max* | 
| fisheye.changeset.paths.limit | 10000 | 0 | unlimited |
| fisheye.pipeline.batch.cslimit | 1000 | 1 | unlimited |
| fisheye.pipeline.batch.pathlimit | 100000 | 1000 | unlimited |

Update documentation:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/jvm-system-properties-960155689.html
fields.summary: Change changeset and path limits for repository indexers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect FIsheye 4.7.x to MySQL 5.5.45+, 5.6.26+ or 5.7.6+

h3. Expected Results
No warning is given.
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
WARN: Establishing SSL connection without server's identity verification is not recommended. According to MySQL 5.5.45+, 5.6.26+ and 5.7.6+ requirements SSL connection must be established by default if explicit option isn't set. For compliance with existing applications not using SSL the verifyServerCertificate property is set to 'false'. You need either to explicitly disable SSL by setting useSSL=false, or set useSSL=true and provide truststore for server certificate verification.
The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The documentation for enabling access logging in Fisheye ([Enabling Access Logging in Fisheye |https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/enabling-access-logging-in-fisheye-960155663.html])
 is not valid for Fisheye 4.6. 
 Following the steps causes Fisheye to exit startup with the following error:
{noformat}
WARN  [main ] org.eclipse.jetty.webapp.WebAppContext WebAppContext-doStart - Failed startup of context c.c.f.w.j.FishEyeWebApplicationContext{/,file:/opt/atlassian/fecru-4.6.0/content/},/op
java.lang.IllegalStateException: No Method: <Call name="insertHandler"><Arg>
          <New id="RequestLog" class="com.cenqua.fisheye.web.jetty.FishEyeRequestLogHandler"><Set name="requestLog">
              <New id="RequestLogImpl" class="org.eclipse.jetty.server.NCSARequestLog"><Set name="filename"><Property name="jetty.logs" default="PATH_LOG_FOLDER"/>/access-yyyy_mm_dd.log</Set><Set name="filenameDat
            </Set></New>
        </Arg></Call> on class com.cenqua.fisheye.web.jetty.FishEyeWebApplicationContext
{noformat}


h3. Steps to reproduce
Follow the current document [Enabling Access Logging in Fisheye|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/enabling-access-logging-in-fisheye-960155663.html] in Fisheye 4.6.x

h3. Expected results
Fisheye/Crucible starts, and creates access log files in the specified directory

h3. Actual results
Fisheye/Crucible fails to start and warns about 
{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalStateException: No Method: <Call name="insertHandler">
{noformat}
in the logs.

h3. Workaround

The following content for the jetty-web.xml file will enable Fisheye to start and write access logs.
{code:xml}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?>
<!DOCTYPE Configure PUBLIC "-//Mort Bay Consulting//DTD Configure//EN" "http://www.eclipse.org/jetty/configure.dtd" >
<Configure class="org.eclipse.jetty.webapp.WebAppContext">
  <Set name="handler">
    <New class="com.cenqua.fisheye.web.jetty.FishEyeRequestLogHandler">
      <Set name="requestLog">
        <New id="RequestLogImpl" class="org.eclipse.jetty.server.NCSARequestLog">
          <Arg><SystemProperty name="jetty.logs" default="./var/log/" />atlassian-fisheye-access-yyyy_MM_dd.log</Arg>
           <Set name="filenameDateFormat">yyyy_MM_dd</Set>
          <Set name="retainDays">90</Set>
          <Set name="append">true</Set>
          <Set name="extended">false</Set>
          <Set name="LogTimeZone">GMT</Set>
        </New>
      </Set>
    </New>
  </Set>
</Configure>
{code}

h3. Documentation improvement suggestion
Update the document to add the above content for jetty-web.xml specifically for Fisheye version 4.6
fields.summary: Following the documentation for enabling access logging in Fisheye 4.6 causes Fisheye to exit startup.

fields.description:
When the 8.x version of the driver is used, the Active Objects library does not function properly, see the https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AO-3462 for details.

According to [this comment|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AO-3462?focusedCommentId=447192&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-447192] it is necessary to set {{nullCatalogMeansCurrent=true}} connection property.

Add this property by default whenever a MySQL database is used in Fisheye/Crucible.
fields.summary: Support MySQL JDBC Connector 8.x

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Bitbucket repository is being added to Fisheye (via 'Bitbucket Server Repositories' tab), Fisheye is unable to clone and index it. It's caused by the fact that the private ssh key generated has file permissions which allow to read it by other users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Fisheye (using its Windows installer) and Bitbucket on Windows and connect via application link
 # Install Git
 # Create a repository in Bitbucket and add it in Fisheye using 'Bitbucket repositories' tab

h3. Expected Results

Repository is cloned and indexed.
h3. Actual Results

Repository cloning fails because the private key is unprotected:

!windows-git-ssh-private-key-permissions.png|thumbnail!

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-fisheye-YYYY-MM-DD.log file:
{noformat}
2019-10-30 01:52:41,574 WARN  [InitPing3 repo ] fisheye IndexingPingRequest-doRequest - Exception during Fisheye Incremental Indexing of repo (repo): com.cenqua.fisheye.config.ConfigException: Unable to clone remote repository: ssh://git@localhost:7999/abc/repo.git
     - [Cloning into bare repository 'clone'..., , @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@, 
@         WARNING: UNPROTECTED PRIVATE KEY FILE!          @, @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@, 
Permissions for 'C:\\Atlassian\\Data\\fecru-4.6.1\\data\\auth\\repo' are too open., 
It is required that your private key files are NOT accessible by others., 
This private key will be ignored., 
Load key "C:\\Atlassian\\Data\\fecru-4.6.1\\data\\auth\\repo": bad permissions, 
git@localhost: Permission denied (publickey)., 
fatal: Could not read from remote repository., 
, Please make sure you have the correct access rights, and the repository exists.]
{noformat}
h3. Cause

When the Fisheye installer is executed from the administrator account, but without the "Run as administrator" option, the current user is being added to permission entries for the data folder:

!without-run-as-administrator.png|thumbnail!  

When "Run as administrator" option is used, the current user (even if it is an admin) is not being added:

!with-run-as-administrator.png|thumbnail!  

The superfluous user in the first case causes ssh to complain about file permissions.
h3. Workaround

Restrict permissions of private keys stored in the `$FISHEYE_INST\data\auth` directory.

File Explorer > (right click on a file) > Properties > Security tab > Advanced

Disable inheritance > Convert inherited permissions into explicit permissions on this object

Remove any regular users - keep 'Network Service', 'SYSTEM' and the 'Administrators' group. Example:

!repository-private-key-permisssions.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: After adding a Bitbucket repository Fisheye is unable to clone it
